   20: 
   21: -module(crashdump_viewer_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("observer/src/crashdump_viewer.hrl").
   24: 
   25: %% Test functions
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   27: 	 start_stop/1,load_file/1,not_found_items/1,
   28: 	 non_existing/1,not_a_crashdump/1,old_crashdump/1,new_crashdump/1]).
   29: -export([init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   30: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   31: 
   32: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   33: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   34: 
   35: -define(failed_file,"failed-cases.txt").
   36: -define(helper_mod,crashdump_helper).
   37: 
   38: %% -define(P(F),    print(F)).
   39: -define(P(F, A), print(F, A)).
   40: 
   41: 
   42: init_per_testcase(start_stop, Config) ->
   43:     catch crashdump_viewer:stop(),
   44:     try
   45: 	case os:type() of
   46: 	    {unix,darwin} ->
   47: 		exit("Can not test on MacOSX");
   48:             {unix,sunos} ->
   49:                 exit("Skip on sunos, for now");
   50: 	    {unix, _} ->
   51:                 Display = os:getenv("DISPLAY"),
   52: 		io:format("DISPLAY ~s~n", [Display]),
   53: 		case ct:get_config(xserver, none) of
   54: 		    none -> ignore;
   55:                     Display -> ok;
   56: 		    Server ->
   57:                         os:putenv("DISPLAY", Server), %% Might work if new node is spawned
   58:                         io:format("Config sets other x-server than the DISPLAY\n"
   59:                                   "the DISPLAY variable must be set when starting erlang")
   60: 		end;
   61: 	    _ -> ignore
   62: 	end,
   63: 	wx:new(),
   64: 	wx:destroy(),
   65: 	Config
   66:     catch
   67: 	_:undef ->
   68: 	    {skipped, "No wx compiled for this platform"};
   69: 	_:Reason ->
   70: 	    SkipReason = io_lib:format("Start wx failed: ~p", [Reason]),
   71: 	    {skipped, lists:flatten(SkipReason)}
   72:     end;
   73: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   74:     catch crashdump_viewer:stop(),
   75:     Config.
   76: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
   77:     case ?config(tc_status,Config) of
   78: 	ok ->
   79: 	    ok;
   80: 	_Fail ->
   81: 	    File = filename:join(?config(data_dir,Config),?failed_file),
   82: 	    {ok,Fd}=file:open(File,[append]),
   83: 	    file:write(Fd,io_lib:format("~w.~n",[Case])),
   84: 	    file:close(Fd)
   85:     end,
   86:     ok.
   87: 
   88: suite() -> [].
   89: 
   90: all() -> 
   91:     [start_stop,
   92:      non_existing,
   93:      not_a_crashdump,
   94:      old_crashdump,
   95:      new_crashdump,
   96:      load_file,
   97:      not_found_items
   98:     ].
   99: 
  100: groups() -> 
  101:     [].
  102: 
  103: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  104:     Config.
  105: 
  106: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  107:     Config.
  108: 
  109: 
  110: %% Create a lot of crashdumps which can be used in the testcases below
  111: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  112:     delete_saved(Config),
  113:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Config),
  114:     CurrVsn = list_to_integer(erlang:system_info(otp_release)),
  115:     OldRels = [R || R <- [CurrVsn-2,CurrVsn-1],
  116: 		    test_server:is_release_available(list_to_atom(integer_to_list(R)))],
  117:     Rels = OldRels ++ [current],
  118:     io:format("Creating crash dumps for the following releases: ~p", [Rels]),
  119:     AllDumps = create_dumps(DataDir,Rels),
  120:     [{dumps,AllDumps}|Config].
  121: 
  122: delete_saved(Config) ->
  123:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Config),
  124:     file:delete(filename:join(DataDir,?failed_file)),
  125:     SaveDir = filename:join(DataDir,"save"),
  126:     Dumps = filelib:wildcard(filename:join(SaveDir,"*")),
  127:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> file:delete(F) end, Dumps),
  128:     file:del_dir(SaveDir),
  129:     ok.
  130: 
  131: 
  132: start_stop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  133:     Dump = hd(?config(dumps,Config)),
  134:     timer:sleep(1000),
  135: 
  136:     ProcsBefore = processes(),
  137:     NumProcsBefore = length(ProcsBefore),
  138:     ok = crashdump_viewer:start(Dump),
  139:     ExpectedRegistered = [crashdump_viewer_server,
  140: 			  cdv_wx,
  141: 			  cdv_proc_cb,
  142: 			  cdv_proc_cb__holder,
  143: 			  cdv_port_cb,
  144: 			  cdv_port_cb__holder,
  145: 			  cdv_ets_cb,
  146: 			  cdv_ets_cb__holder,
  147: 			  cdv_timer_cb,
  148: 			  cdv_timer_cb__holder,
  149: 			  cdv_fun_cb,
  150: 			  cdv_fun_cb__holder,
  151: 			  cdv_atom_cb,
  152: 			  cdv_atom_cb__holder,
  153: 			  cdv_dist_cb,
  154: 			  cdv_dist_cb__holder,
  155: 			  cdv_mod_cb,
  156: 			  cdv_mod_cb__holder],
  157:     Regs=[begin
  158: 	      P=whereis(N),
  159: 	      {P,N,erlang:monitor(process,P)}
  160: 	  end || N <- ExpectedRegistered],
  161:     ct:log("CDV procs: ~n~p~n",[Regs]),
  162:     [true=is_pid(P) || {P,_,_} <- Regs],
  163:     timer:sleep(5000), % give some time to live
  164:     ct:log("try stop crashdump viewer (async)~n"),
  165:     ok = crashdump_viewer:stop(),
  166:     ct:log("await crashdump viewer processes termination~n"),
  167:     recv_downs(Regs),
  168:     ct:log("sleep some~n"),
  169:     timer:sleep(2000),
  170:     ct:log("try get all processes~n"),
  171:     ProcsAfter = processes(),
  172:     NumProcsAfter = length(ProcsAfter),
  173:     ct:log("try verify crashdump viewer stopped~n"),
  174:     if (NumProcsAfter =/= NumProcsBefore) ->
  175: 	    ct:log("Leaking processes: "
  176:                    "~n   Before but not after:"
  177:                    "~n      ~p"
  178:                    "~n   After but not before:"
  179:                    "~n      ~p",
  180: 		   [
  181:                     [{P,process_info(P)} || P <- ProcsBefore -- ProcsAfter],
  182:                     [{P,process_info(P)} || P <- ProcsAfter -- ProcsBefore]
  183:                    ]);
  184:        true ->
  185: 	    ok
  186:     end,
  187:     ok.
  188: 
  189: recv_downs([]) ->
  190:     ct:log("'DOWN' received from all registered processes~n", []),
  191:     ok;
  192: recv_downs(Regs) ->
  193:     receive
  194: 	{'DOWN', Ref, process, _Pid, _} ->
  195:             Regs2 = lists:keydelete(Ref, 3, Regs),
  196: 	    ct:log("Got 'DOWN' for process ~p (~w procs remaining)~n",
  197:                    [_Pid, length(Regs2)]),
  198: 	    recv_downs(Regs2)
  199:     after 30000 ->
  200: 	    ct:log("Timeout waiting for down:~n~p~n",
  201: 		   [[{Reg,process_info(P)} || {P,_,_}=Reg <- Regs]]),
  202: 	    ct:log("Message queue:~n~p~n",[process_info(self(),messages)])
  203:     end.
  204: 
  205: %% Try to load nonexisting file
  206: non_existing(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  207:     ExpectedReason = "non-existing-file is not an Erlang crash dump\n",
  208:     {error, ExpectedReason} = start_backend("non-existing-file"),
  209:     ok = crashdump_viewer:stop().
  210: 
  211: %% Try to load a crashdump of old (earlier than OTP R10B) format
  212: old_crashdump(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  213:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Config),
  214:     OldFile = filename:join(DataDir,"old_format.dump"),
  215:     ExpectedReason = "The crashdump " ++ OldFile ++
  216: 	" is in the pre-R10B format, which is no longer supported.\n",
  217:     {error, ExpectedReason} = start_backend(OldFile),
  218:     ok = crashdump_viewer:stop().
  219: 
  220: %% Try to load a file which is not an erlang crashdump
  221: not_a_crashdump(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  222:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  223:     F1 = filename:join(PrivDir,"f1"),
  224:     F2 = filename:join(PrivDir,"f2"),
  225: 
  226:     file:write_file(F1,"=unexpected_tag:xyz"),
  227:     file:write_file(F2,""),
  228: 
  229:     ExpReason1 = F1 ++ " is not an Erlang crash dump\n",
  230:     ExpReason2 = F2 ++ " is not an Erlang crash dump\n",
  231: 
  232:     {error,ExpReason1} = start_backend(F1),
  233:     {error,ExpReason2} = start_backend(F2),
  234: 
  235:     ok = crashdump_viewer:stop().
  236: 
  237: %% Try to load a file with newer version than this crashdump viewer can handle
  238: new_crashdump(Config) ->
  239:     Dump = hd(?config(dumps,Config)),
  240:     ok = start_backend(Dump),
  241:     {ok,{MaxVsn,CurrentVsn}} = crashdump_viewer:get_dump_versions(),
  242:     if MaxVsn =/= CurrentVsn ->
  243:             ct:fail("Current dump version is not equal to cdv's max version");
  244:        true ->
  245:             ok
  246:     end,
  247:     ok = crashdump_viewer:stop(),
  248:     NewerVsn = lists:join($.,[integer_to_list(X+1) || X <- MaxVsn]),
  249:     PrivDir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  250:     NewDump = filename:join(PrivDir,"new_erl_crash.dump"),
  251:     ok = file:write_file(NewDump,"=erl_crash_dump:"++NewerVsn++"\n"),
  252:     {error, Reason} = start_backend(NewDump),
  253:     "This Crashdump Viewer is too old" ++_ = Reason,
  254:     ok = crashdump_viewer:stop().
  255: 
  256: %% Load files into the tool and view all pages
  257: load_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  258:     case test_server:is_debug() of
  259: 	true ->
  260: 	    {skip,"Debug-compiled emulator -- far too slow"};
  261: 	false ->
  262: 	    load_file_1(Config)
  263:     end.
  264: 
  265: 
  266: load_file_1(Config) ->
  267:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Config),
  268:     crashdump_viewer:start_link(),
  269: 
  270:     %% Read both created and predefined dumps
  271:     AllFiles = filelib:wildcard(filename:join(DataDir,"r*_dump.*")),
  272:     lists:foreach(
  273:       fun(File) ->
  274: 	      Content = browse_file(File),
  275: 	      special(File,Content)
  276:       end,
  277:       AllFiles),
  278:     ok = crashdump_viewer:stop().
  279: 
  280: %% Try to lookup nonexisting process, port and node
  281: not_found_items(Config) ->
  282:     Dump = hd(?config(dumps,Config)),
  283: 
  284:     ok = start_backend(Dump),
  285: 
  286:     {ok,#general_info{},_} = crashdump_viewer:general_info(),
  287: 
  288:     {error,not_found} = crashdump_viewer:proc_details("<1111.1111.1111>"),
  289:     {error,not_found} = crashdump_viewer:port("#Port<1111.1111>"),
  290:     {error,not_found} = crashdump_viewer:node_info("1111"),
  291: 
  292:     ok = crashdump_viewer:stop().
  293: 
  294: %% Remove generated crashdumps
  295: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  296:     Dumps = ?config(dumps,Config),
  297:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Config),
  298:     FailedFile = filename:join(DataDir,?failed_file),
  299:     case filelib:is_file(FailedFile) of
  300: 	true ->
  301: 	    SaveDir = filename:join(DataDir,"save"),
  302: 	    file:make_dir(SaveDir),
  303: 	    file:copy(FailedFile,filename:join(SaveDir,?failed_file)),
  304: 	    lists:foreach(
  305: 	      fun(CD) ->
  306: 		      File = filename:basename(CD),
  307: 		      New = filename:join(SaveDir,File),
  308: 		      file:copy(CD,New)
  309: 	      end, Dumps);
  310: 	false ->
  311: 	    ok
  312:     end,
  313:     file:delete(FailedFile),
  314:     lists:foreach(fun(CD) -> ok = file:delete(CD) end,Dumps),
  315:     lists:keydelete(dumps,1,Config).
  316: 
  317: 
  318: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  319: %%% Internal
  320: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  321: %%% Start the crashdump_viewer backend and load a dump
  322: start_backend(File) ->
  323:     crashdump_viewer:start_link(),
  324:     register_progress_handler(),
  325:     ok = crashdump_viewer:read_file(File),
  326:     wait_for_progress_done().
  327: 
  328: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  329: %%% Simulate the progress handler in observer_lib
  330: register_progress_handler() ->
  331:     register(cdv_progress_handler,self()).
  332: 
  333: wait_for_progress_done() ->
  334:     receive
  335: 	{progress,{error,Reason}} ->
  336: 	    unregister(cdv_progress_handler),
  337: 	    {error,lists:flatten(Reason)};
  338: 	{progress,{ok,done}} ->
  339: 	    unregister(cdv_progress_handler),
  340: 	    ok;
  341: 	{progress,_} ->
  342: 	    wait_for_progress_done()
  343:     end.
  344: 
  345: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  346: %%% General check of what is displayed for a dump
  347: browse_file(File) ->
  348:     io:format("~n[~s] Browsing file: ~s", [formated_timestamp(), File]),
  349:     %% io:format("~nBrowsing file: ~s",[File]),
  350: 
  351:     ok = start_backend(File),
  352: 
  353:     io:format("  backend started",[]),
  354: 
  355:     {ok,_GI=#general_info{},_GenTW} = crashdump_viewer:general_info(),
  356:     {ok,Procs,_ProcsTW} = crashdump_viewer:processes(),
  357:     {ok,Ports,_PortsTW} = crashdump_viewer:ports(),
  358:     {ok,_Ets,_EtsTW} = crashdump_viewer:ets_tables(all),
  359:     {ok,_IntEts,_IntEtsTW} = crashdump_viewer:internal_ets_tables(),
  360:     {ok,_Timers,_TimersTW} = crashdump_viewer:timers(all),
  361:     {ok,_Funs,_FunsTW} = crashdump_viewer:funs(),
  362:     {ok,_Atoms,_AtomsTW} = crashdump_viewer:atoms(),
  363:     {ok,Nodes,_NodesTW} = crashdump_viewer:dist_info(),
  364:     {ok,Mods,_ModsTW} = crashdump_viewer:loaded_modules(),
  365:     {ok,_Mem,_MemTW} = crashdump_viewer:memory(),
  366:     {ok,_AllocAreas,_AreaTW} = crashdump_viewer:allocated_areas(),
  367:     {ok,AllocInfo,_AllocInfoTW} = crashdump_viewer:allocator_info(),
  368:     {ok,_HashTabs,_HashTabsTW} = crashdump_viewer:hash_tables(),
  369:     {ok,_IndexTabs,_IndexTabsTW} = crashdump_viewer:index_tables(),
  370:     {ok,_PTs,_PTsTW} = crashdump_viewer:persistent_terms(),
  371: 
  372:     io:format("  info read",[]),
  373: 
  374:     lookat_all_pids(Procs,is_truncated(File),incomplete_allowed(File)),
  375:     io:format("  pids ok",[]),
  376:     lookat_all_ports(Ports),
  377:     io:format("  ports ok",[]),
  378:     lookat_all_mods(Mods),
  379:     io:format("  mods ok",[]),
  380:     lookat_all_nodes(Nodes),
  381:     io:format("  nodes ok",[]),
  382: 
  383:     lookat_alloc_info(AllocInfo),
  384:     io:format("  alloc info ok",[]),
  385: 
  386:     Procs. % used as second arg to special/2
  387: 
  388: is_truncated(File) ->
  389:     case filename:extension(File) of
  390:         ".trunc"++_ ->
  391:             true;
  392:         _ ->
  393:             false
  394:     end.
  395: 
  396: incomplete_allowed(File) ->
  397:     %% Incomplete heap is allowed for pre OTP-20 (really pre 20.2)
  398:     %% releases, since literals were not dumped at all then.
  399:     Rel = get_rel_from_dump_name(File),
  400:     Rel < 20.
  401: 
  402: special(File,Procs) ->
  403:     case filename:extension(File) of
  404: 	".full_dist" ->
  405: 	    %% I registered a process as aaaaaaaa in the full_dist dumps 
  406: 	    %% to make sure it will be the first in the list when sorted
  407: 	    %% on names. There are some special data here, so I'll thoroughly
  408: 	    %% read the process details for this process. Other processes
  409: 	    %% are just briefly traversed.
  410: 	    [#proc{pid=Pid0}|_Rest] = lists:keysort(#proc.name,Procs),
  411: 	    Pid = pid_to_list(Pid0),
  412: 	    {ok,ProcDetails=#proc{},[]} = crashdump_viewer:proc_details(Pid),
  413: 	    io:format("  process details ok",[]),
  414: 
  415: 	    #proc{dict=Dict} = ProcDetails,
  416: 
  417: 	    ['#CDVBin',Offset,Size,Pos] = proplists:get_value(bin,Dict),
  418: 	    {ok,<<_:Size/binary>>} =
  419: 		crashdump_viewer:expand_binary({Offset,Size,Pos}),
  420: 	    {ok,'#CDVTruncatedBinary'} =
  421: 		crashdump_viewer:expand_binary({Offset,Size+1,Pos}),
  422: 	    ['#CDVBin',SOffset,SSize,SPos] = proplists:get_value(sub_bin,Dict),
  423: 	    {ok,<<_:SSize/binary>>} =
  424: 		crashdump_viewer:expand_binary({SOffset,SSize,SPos}),
  425: 	    io:format("  expand binary ok",[]),
  426: 
  427:             ProcBins = proplists:get_value(proc_bins,Dict),
  428:             {['#CDVBin',0,65,ProcBin],
  429:              ['#CDVBin',65,65,ProcBin],
  430:              ['#CDVBin',130,125,ProcBin]} = ProcBins,
  431:             io:format("  ProcBins ok",[]),
  432: 
  433: 
  434:             Binaries = crashdump_helper:create_binaries(),
  435:             verify_binaries(Binaries, proplists:get_value(bins,Dict)),
  436: 	    io:format("  binaries ok",[]),
  437: 
  438:             SubBinaries = crashdump_helper:create_sub_binaries(Binaries),
  439:             verify_binaries(SubBinaries, proplists:get_value(sub_bins,Dict)),
  440: 	    io:format("  sub binaries ok",[]),
  441: 
  442: 	    #proc{last_calls=LastCalls} = ProcDetails,
  443:             true = length(LastCalls) =< 4,
  444: 
  445: 	    ['#CDVPid',X1,Y1,Z1] = proplists:get_value(ext_pid,Dict),
  446: 	    ChannelStr1 = integer_to_list(X1),
  447: 	    ExtPid =
  448: 		"<" ++ ChannelStr1 ++ "." ++
  449: 		integer_to_list(Y1) ++ "." ++
  450: 		integer_to_list(Z1) ++ ">",
  451: 	    {error,{other_node,ChannelStr1}} =
  452: 		crashdump_viewer:proc_details(ExtPid),
  453: 	    io:format("  process details external ok",[]),
  454: 
  455: 	    ['#CDVPort',X2,Y2] = proplists:get_value(port,Dict),
  456: 	    ChannelStr2 = integer_to_list(X2),
  457: 	    Port = "#Port<"++ChannelStr2++"."++integer_to_list(Y2)++">",
  458: 	    {ok,_PortDetails=#port{},[]} = crashdump_viewer:port(Port),
  459: 	    io:format("  port details ok",[]),
  460: 
  461: 	    ['#CDVPort',X3,Y3] = proplists:get_value(ext_port,Dict),
  462: 	    ChannelStr3 = integer_to_list(X3),
  463: 	    ExtPort = "#Port<"++ChannelStr3++"."++integer_to_list(Y3)++">",
  464: 	    {error,{other_node,ChannelStr3}} = crashdump_viewer:port(ExtPort),
  465: 	    io:format("  port details external ok",[]),
  466: 
  467: 	    {ok,[_Ets=#ets_table{}],[]} = crashdump_viewer:ets_tables(Pid),
  468: 	    io:format("  ets tables ok",[]),
  469: 
  470: 	    {ok,[#timer{pid=Pid0,name=undefined},
  471: 		 #timer{pid=Pid0,name="aaaaaaaa"}],[]} =
  472: 		crashdump_viewer:timers(Pid),
  473: 	    {ok,AllTimers,_TimersTW} = crashdump_viewer:timers(all),
  474: 	    #timer{name="noexistproc"} =
  475: 		lists:keyfind(undefined,#timer.pid,AllTimers),
  476: 	    io:format("  timers ok:",[]),
  477: 
  478: 	    {ok,Mod1=#loaded_mod{},[]} =
  479: 		crashdump_viewer:loaded_mod_details(atom_to_list(?helper_mod)),
  480: 	    io:format("  modules ok",[]),
  481: 	    #loaded_mod{current_size=CS, old_size=OS,
  482: 			old_attrib=A,old_comp_info=C}=Mod1,
  483: 	    true = is_integer(CS),
  484: 	    true = (CS==OS),
  485: 	    true = (A=/=undefined),
  486: 	    true = (C=/=undefined),
  487: 	    {ok,Mod2=#loaded_mod{},[]} =
  488: 		crashdump_viewer:loaded_mod_details("application"),
  489: 	    io:format("  module details ok",[]),
  490: 	    #loaded_mod{old_size="No old code exists",
  491: 			old_attrib=undefined,
  492: 			old_comp_info=undefined}=Mod2,
  493: 	    ok;
  494:         ".trunc_mod" ->
  495:             ModName = atom_to_list(?helper_mod),
  496:             {ok,Mod=#loaded_mod{},[TW]} =
  497:                 crashdump_viewer:loaded_mod_details(ModName),
  498:             "WARNING: The crash dump is truncated here."++_ = TW,
  499:             #loaded_mod{current_attrib=CA,current_comp_info=CCI,
  500:                         old_attrib=OA,old_comp_info=OCI} = Mod,
  501:             case lists:all(fun(undefined) ->
  502:                                    true;
  503:                               (S) when is_list(S) ->
  504:                                    io_lib:printable_unicode_list(lists:flatten(S));
  505:                               (_) -> false
  506:                            end,
  507:                            [CA,CCI,OA,OCI]) of
  508:                 true ->
  509:                     ok;
  510:                 false ->
  511:                     ct:fail({should_be_printable_strings_or_undefined,
  512:                              {CA,CCI,OA,OCI}})
  513:             end,
  514:             ok;
  515: 	".trunc_bin1" ->
  516:             %% This is 'full_dist' truncated after the first
  517:             %% "=binary:"
  518:             %% i.e. no binary exist in the dump
  519: 	    [#proc{pid=Pid0}|_Rest] = lists:keysort(#proc.name,Procs),
  520: 	    Pid = pid_to_list(Pid0),
  521:             %%WarnIncompleteHeap = ["WARNING: This process has an incomplete heap. Some information might be missing."],
  522: 	    {ok,ProcDetails=#proc{},[]} =
  523:                 crashdump_viewer:proc_details(Pid),
  524: 	    io:format("  process details ok",[]),
  525: 
  526: 	    #proc{dict=Dict} = ProcDetails,
  527: 
  528: 	    '#CDVNonexistingBinary' = proplists:get_value(bin,Dict),
  529: 	    '#CDVNonexistingBinary' = proplists:get_value(sub_bin,Dict),
  530: 
  531: 	    io:format("  nonexisting binaries ok",[]),
  532:             ok;
  533: 	".trunc_bin2" ->
  534:             %% This is 'full_dist' truncated after the first
  535:             %% "=binary:Addr\n
  536:             %%  Size"
  537:             %% i.e. binaries are truncated
  538: 	    [#proc{pid=Pid0}|_Rest] = lists:keysort(#proc.name,Procs),
  539: 	    Pid = pid_to_list(Pid0),
  540: 	    {ok,ProcDetails=#proc{},[]} = crashdump_viewer:proc_details(Pid),
  541: 	    io:format("  process details ok",[]),
  542: 
  543: 	    #proc{dict=Dict} = ProcDetails,
  544: 
  545: 	    ['#CDVBin',Offset,Size,Pos] = proplists:get_value(bin,Dict),
  546:             {ok,'#CDVTruncatedBinary'} =
  547: 		crashdump_viewer:expand_binary({Offset,Size,Pos}),
  548: 	    ['#CDVBin',SOffset,SSize,SPos] = proplists:get_value(sub_bin,Dict),
  549:             {ok,'#CDVTruncatedBinary'} =
  550: 		crashdump_viewer:expand_binary({SOffset,SSize,SPos}),
  551: 
  552: 	    io:format("  expand truncated binary ok",[]),
  553:             ok;
  554: 	".trunc_bin3" ->
  555:             %% This is 'full_dist' truncated after the first
  556:             %% "=binary:Addr\n
  557:             %%  Size:"
  558:             %% i.e. same as 'trunc_bin2', except the colon exists also
  559: 	    [#proc{pid=Pid0}|_Rest] = lists:keysort(#proc.name,Procs),
  560: 	    Pid = pid_to_list(Pid0),
  561: 	    {ok,ProcDetails=#proc{},[]} = crashdump_viewer:proc_details(Pid),
  562: 	    io:format("  process details ok",[]),
  563: 
  564: 	    #proc{dict=Dict} = ProcDetails,
  565: 
  566: 	    ['#CDVBin',Offset,Size,Pos] = proplists:get_value(bin,Dict),
  567:             {ok,'#CDVTruncatedBinary'} =
  568: 		crashdump_viewer:expand_binary({Offset,Size,Pos}),
  569: 	    ['#CDVBin',SOffset,SSize,SPos] = proplists:get_value(sub_bin,Dict),
  570:             {ok,'#CDVTruncatedBinary'} =
  571: 		crashdump_viewer:expand_binary({SOffset,SSize,SPos}),
  572: 
  573: 	    io:format("  expand truncated binary ok",[]),
  574:             ok;
  575: 	".trunc_bin4" ->
  576:             %% This is 'full_dist' truncated after the first
  577:             %% "=binary:Addr\n
  578:             %%  Size:BinaryMissinOneByte"
  579:             %% i.e. the full binary is truncated, but the sub binary is complete
  580: 	    [#proc{pid=Pid0}|_Rest] = lists:keysort(#proc.name,Procs),
  581: 	    Pid = pid_to_list(Pid0),
  582: 	    {ok,ProcDetails=#proc{},[]} = crashdump_viewer:proc_details(Pid),
  583: 	    io:format("  process details ok",[]),
  584: 
  585: 	    #proc{dict=Dict} = ProcDetails,
  586: 
  587: 	    ['#CDVBin',Offset,Size,Pos] = proplists:get_value(bin,Dict),
  588:             {ok,'#CDVTruncatedBinary'} =
  589: 		crashdump_viewer:expand_binary({Offset,Size,Pos}),
  590: 	    io:format("  expand truncated binary ok",[]),
  591: 	    ['#CDVBin',SOffset,SSize,SPos] = proplists:get_value(sub_bin,Dict),
  592:             {ok,<<_:SSize/binary>>} =
  593: 		crashdump_viewer:expand_binary({SOffset,SSize,SPos}),
  594: 	    io:format("  expand complete sub binary ok",[]),
  595: 
  596:             ok;
  597:         ".trunc_bytes" ->
  598:             {ok,_,[TW]} = crashdump_viewer:general_info(),
  599:             {match,_} = re:run(TW,"CRASH DUMP SIZE LIMIT REACHED"),
  600: 	    io:format("  size limit information ok",[]),
  601:             ok;
  602:         ".unicode" ->
  603:             #proc{pid=Pid0} =
  604:                 lists:keyfind("'unicode_reg_name_αβ'",#proc.name,Procs),
  605:             Pid = pid_to_list(Pid0),
  606: 	    {ok,Proc,[]} = crashdump_viewer:proc_details(Pid),
  607:             #proc{last_calls=LastCalls,stack_dump=Stk} = Proc,
  608:             io:format("  unicode registered name ok",[]),
  609: 
  610:             ["crashdump_helper_unicode:'спутник'/0",
  611:              "ets:new/2"|_] = lists:reverse(LastCalls),
  612:             io:format("  last calls ok",[]),
  613: 
  614:             verify_unicode_stack(Stk),
  615:             io:format("  unicode stack values ok",[]),
  616: 
  617: 	    {ok,[#ets_table{id="'tab_αβ'",name="'tab_αβ'"}],[]} =
  618:                 crashdump_viewer:ets_tables(Pid),
  619:             io:format("  unicode table name ok",[]),
  620: 
  621:             ok;
  622:         ".maps" ->
  623: 	    %% I registered a process as aaaaaaaa_maps in the map dump
  624: 	    %% to make sure it will be the first in the list when sorted
  625: 	    %% on names.
  626: 	    [#proc{pid=Pid0,name=Name}|_Rest] = lists:keysort(#proc.name,Procs),
  627:             "aaaaaaaa_maps" = Name,
  628: 	    Pid = pid_to_list(Pid0),
  629: 	    {ok,ProcDetails=#proc{},[]} = crashdump_viewer:proc_details(Pid),
  630: 	    io:format("  process details ok",[]),
  631: 
  632: 	    #proc{dict=Dict} = ProcDetails,
  633:             %% io:format("~p\n", [Dict]),
  634:             Maps = crashdump_helper:create_maps(),
  635:             Maps = proplists:get_value(maps,Dict),
  636:             io:format("  maps ok",[]),
  637:             ok;
  638:         ".persistent_terms" ->
  639: 	    %% I registered a process as aaaaaaaa_persistent_term in
  640: 	    %% the dump to make sure it will be the first in the list
  641: 	    %% when sorted on names.
  642: 	    [#proc{pid=Pid0,name=Name}|_Rest] = lists:keysort(#proc.name,Procs),
  643:             "aaaaaaaa_persistent_terms" = Name,
  644: 	    Pid = pid_to_list(Pid0),
  645: 	    {ok,ProcDetails=#proc{},[]} = crashdump_viewer:proc_details(Pid),
  646: 	    io:format("  process details ok",[]),
  647: 
  648: 	    #proc{dict=Dict} = ProcDetails,
  649:             %% io:format("~p\n", [Dict]),
  650:             Pts = crashdump_helper:create_persistent_terms(),
  651:             Pts = proplists:get_value(pts,Dict),
  652:             io:format("  persistent terms ok",[]),
  653:             ok;
  654:         ".global_literals" ->
  655: 	    %% I registered a process as aaaaaaaa_global_literals in
  656: 	    %% the dump to make sure it will be the first in the list
  657: 	    %% when sorted on names.
  658: 	    [#proc{pid=Pid0,name=Name}|_Rest] = lists:keysort(#proc.name,Procs),
  659:             "aaaaaaaa_global_literals" = Name,
  660: 	    Pid = pid_to_list(Pid0),
  661: 	    {ok,ProcDetails=#proc{},[]} = crashdump_viewer:proc_details(Pid),
  662: 	    io:format("  process details ok",[]),
  663: 
  664: 	    #proc{dict=Dict} = ProcDetails,
  665:             Globals = proplists:get_value(global_literals,Dict),
  666:             Globals = {os:type(),os:version()},
  667:             io:format("  global_literals ok",[]),
  668:             ok;
  669: 	_ ->
  670: 	    ok
  671:     end,
  672:     ok.
  673: 
  674: verify_unicode_stack([{_,{state,Str,Atom,Bin,LongBin}}|_]) ->
  675:     'unicode_atom_αβ' = Atom,
  676:     "unicode_string_αβ" = Str,
  677:     <<"bin αβ"/utf8>> = Bin,
  678:     <<"long bin αβ - a utf8 binary which can be expanded αβ"/utf8>> = LongBin,
  679:     ok;
  680: verify_unicode_stack([_|T]) ->
  681:     verify_unicode_stack(T).
  682: 
  683: verify_binaries([H|T1], [H|T2]) ->
  684:     %% Heap binary.
  685:     verify_binaries(T1, T2);
  686: verify_binaries([Bin|T1], [['#CDVBin',Offset,Size,Pos]|T2]) ->
  687:     %% Refc binary.
  688:     {ok,<<Bin:Size/binary>>} = crashdump_viewer:expand_binary({Offset,Size,Pos}),
  689:     verify_binaries(T1, T2);
  690: verify_binaries([], []) ->
  691:     ok.
  692: 
  693: lookat_all_pids([],_,_) ->
  694:     ok;
  695: lookat_all_pids([#proc{pid=Pid0}|Procs],TruncAllowed,IncompAllowed) ->
  696:     Pid = pid_to_list(Pid0),
  697:     {ok,_ProcDetails=#proc{},ProcTW} = crashdump_viewer:proc_details(Pid),
  698:     {ok,_Ets,EtsTW} = crashdump_viewer:ets_tables(Pid),
  699:     {ok,_Timers,TimersTW} = crashdump_viewer:timers(Pid),
  700:     case {ProcTW,EtsTW,TimersTW} of
  701:         {[],[],[]} ->
  702:             ok;
  703:         {["WARNING: This process has an incomplete heap."++_],[],[]}
  704: 	when IncompAllowed ->
  705:             ok;  % native libs, literals might not be included in dump
  706:         _ when TruncAllowed ->
  707:             ok; % truncated dump
  708:         TWs ->
  709: 	    ?P("lookat_all_pids -> unexpected warning"
  710: 	       "~n   Pid:           ~s"
  711: 	       "~n   IncompAllowed: ~p"
  712: 	       "~n   TruncAllowed:  ~p"
  713: 	       "~n   ~p", [Pid, IncompAllowed, TruncAllowed, TWs]),
  714:             ct:fail({unexpected_warning, Pid, TWs, IncompAllowed, TruncAllowed})
  715:     end,
  716:     lookat_all_pids(Procs,TruncAllowed,IncompAllowed).
  717: 
  718: lookat_all_ports([]) ->
  719:     ok;
  720: lookat_all_ports([#port{id=Port0}|Procs]) ->
  721:     Port = cdv_port_cb:format(Port0),
  722:     {ok,_PortDetails=#port{},_PortTW} = crashdump_viewer:port(Port),
  723:     lookat_all_ports(Procs).
  724: 
  725: lookat_all_mods([]) ->
  726:     ok;
  727: lookat_all_mods([#loaded_mod{mod=ModId}|Mods]) ->
  728:     ModName = cdv_mod_cb:format(ModId),
  729:     {ok,_Mod=#loaded_mod{},_ModTW} = crashdump_viewer:loaded_mod_details(ModName),
  730:     lookat_all_mods(Mods).
  731: 
  732: lookat_all_nodes([]) ->
  733:     ok;
  734: lookat_all_nodes([#nod{channel=Channel0}|Nodes]) ->
  735:     Channel = integer_to_list(Channel0),
  736:     {ok,_Node=#nod{},_NodeTW} = crashdump_viewer:node_info(Channel),
  737:     lookat_all_nodes(Nodes).
  738: 
  739: lookat_alloc_info([AllocSummary|_]) ->
  740:     {"Allocator Summary",
  741:      ["blocks size", "carriers size", "mseg carriers size"],
  742:      Data
  743:     } = AllocSummary,
  744: 
  745:     %% All values must be integer.
  746:     _ = [list_to_integer(IntStr) || {_,[_,_,_]=L} <- Data, IntStr <- L],
  747: 
  748:     ok.
  749: 
  750: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  751: %%% 
  752: create_dumps(DataDir,Rels) ->
  753:     create_dumps(DataDir,Rels,[]).
  754: create_dumps(DataDir,[Rel|Rels],Acc) ->
  755:     Fun = fun() -> do_create_dumps(DataDir,Rel) end,
  756:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  757:     {Dumps,DosDump} =
  758: 	test_server:run_on_shielded_node(Fun, compat_rel(Rel) ++ "-pa \"" ++ Pa ++ "\""),
  759:     create_dumps(DataDir,Rels,Dumps ++ Acc ++ DosDump);
  760: create_dumps(_DataDir,[],Acc) ->
  761:     Acc.
  762: 
  763: do_create_dumps(DataDir,Rel) ->
  764:     CD1 = full_dist_dump(DataDir,Rel),
  765:     CD2 = dump_with_args(DataDir,Rel,"port_is_unix_fd","-oldshell"),
  766:     DosDump = 
  767: 	case os:type() of
  768: 	    {unix,sunos} -> dos_dump(DataDir,Rel,CD1);
  769: 	    _ -> []
  770: 	end,
  771:     case Rel of
  772: 	current ->
  773: 	    CD3 = dump_with_args(DataDir,Rel,"instr","+Muatags true"),
  774: 	    CD4 = dump_with_strange_module_name(DataDir,Rel,"strangemodname"),
  775:             CD5 = dump_with_size_limit_reached(DataDir,Rel,"trunc_bytes"),
  776:             CD6 = dump_with_unicode_atoms(DataDir,Rel,"unicode"),
  777:             CD7 = dump_with_maps(DataDir,Rel,"maps"),
  778:             CD8 = dump_with_persistent_terms(DataDir,Rel,"persistent_terms"),
  779:             CD9 = dump_with_global_literals(DataDir,Rel,"global_literals"),
  780:             TruncDumpMod = truncate_dump_mod(CD1),
  781:             TruncatedDumpsBinary = truncate_dump_binary(CD1),
  782: 	    {[CD1,CD2,CD3,CD4,CD5,CD6,CD7,CD8,CD9,
  783:               TruncDumpMod|TruncatedDumpsBinary],
  784:              DosDump};
  785: 	_ ->
  786: 	    {[CD1,CD2], DosDump}
  787:     end.
  788: 
  789: truncate_dump_mod(File) ->
  790:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File),
  791:     ModNameBin = atom_to_binary(?helper_mod,latin1),
  792:     NewLine = case os:type() of
  793:                   {win32,_} -> <<"\r\n">>;
  794:                   _ -> <<"\n">>
  795:               end,
  796:     RE = <<NewLine/binary,"=mod:",ModNameBin/binary,
  797:            NewLine/binary,"Current size: [0-9]*",
  798:            NewLine/binary,"Current attributes: ...">>,
  799:     {match,[{Pos,Len}]} = re:run(Bin,RE),
  800:     Size = Pos + Len,
  801:     <<Truncated:Size/binary,_/binary>> = Bin,
  802:     DumpName = filename:rootname(File) ++ ".trunc_mod",
  803:     file:write_file(DumpName,Truncated),
  804:     DumpName.
  805: 
  806: truncate_dump_binary(File) ->
  807:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File),
  808:     BinTag = <<"\n=binary:">>,
  809:     Colon = <<":">>,
  810:     NewLine = case os:type() of
  811:                   {win32,_} -> <<"\r\n">>;
  812:                   _ -> <<"\n">>
  813:               end,
  814:     %% Split after "our binary" created by crashdump_helper
  815:     %% (it may not be the first binary).
  816:     RE = <<"\n=binary:(?=[0-9A-Z]+",NewLine/binary,"FF:AQID)">>,
  817:     [StartBin,AfterTag] = re:split(Bin,RE,[{parts,2}]),
  818:     [AddrAndSize,BinaryAndRest] = binary:split(AfterTag,Colon),
  819:     [Binary,_Rest] = binary:split(BinaryAndRest,NewLine),
  820:     TruncSize = byte_size(Binary) - 2,
  821:     <<TruncBinary:TruncSize/binary,_/binary>> = Binary,
  822:     TruncName = filename:rootname(File) ++ ".trunc_bin",
  823:     write_trunc_files(TruncName,StartBin,
  824:                       [BinTag,AddrAndSize,Colon,TruncBinary],1).
  825: 
  826: write_trunc_files(TruncName0,Bin,[Part|Parts],N) ->
  827:     TruncName = TruncName0++integer_to_list(N),
  828:     Bin1 = <<Bin/binary,Part/binary>>,
  829:     ok = file:write_file(TruncName,Bin1),
  830:     [TruncName|write_trunc_files(TruncName0,Bin1,Parts,N+1)];
  831: write_trunc_files(_,_,[],_) ->
  832:     [].
  833: 
  834: 
  835: %% Create a dump which has three visible nodes, one hidden and one
  836: %% not connected node, and with monitors and links between nodes.
  837: %% One of the visible nodes is stopped and started again in order to
  838: %% get multiple creations.
  839: full_dist_dump(DataDir,Rel) ->
  840:     Opt = rel_opt(Rel),
  841:     Pz = "-pz \"" ++ filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)) ++ "\"",
  842:     PzOpt = [{args,Pz}],
  843:     {ok,N1} = test_server:start_node(n1,peer,Opt ++ PzOpt),
  844:     {ok,N2} = test_server:start_node(n2,peer,Opt ++ PzOpt),
  845:     {ok,N3} = test_server:start_node(n3,peer,Opt ++ PzOpt),
  846:     {ok,N4} = test_server:start_node(n4,peer,Opt ++ [{args,"-hidden " ++ Pz}]),
  847:     Creator = self(),
  848: 
  849:     P1 = rpc:call(N1,?helper_mod,n1_proc,[N2,Creator]),
  850:     P2 = rpc:call(N2,?helper_mod,remote_proc,[P1,Creator]),
  851:     P3 = rpc:call(N3,?helper_mod,remote_proc,[P1,Creator]),
  852:     P4 = rpc:call(N4,?helper_mod,remote_proc,[P1,Creator]),
  853:     
  854:     get_response(P2),
  855:     get_response(P3),
  856:     get_response(P4),
  857:     get_response(P1),
  858: 
  859:     %% start, stop and start a node in order to get multiple 'creations'
  860:     {ok,N5} = test_server:start_node(n5,peer,Opt ++ PzOpt),
  861:     P51 = rpc:call(N5,?helper_mod,remote_proc,[P1,Creator]),
  862:     get_response(P51),
  863:     test_server:stop_node(N5),
  864:     {ok,N5} = test_server:start_node(n5,peer,Opt ++ PzOpt),
  865:     P52 = rpc:call(N5,?helper_mod,remote_proc,[P1,Creator]),
  866:     get_response(P52),
  867: 
  868:     {aaaaaaaa,N1} ! {hello,from,other,node}, % distribution message
  869:     
  870:     test_server:stop_node(N3),
  871:     DumpName = "full_dist",
  872:     CD = dump(N1,DataDir,Rel,DumpName),
  873: 
  874:     test_server:stop_node(N2),
  875:     test_server:stop_node(N4),
  876:     test_server:stop_node(N5),
  877:     CD.
  878: 
  879: get_response(P) ->
  880:     receive {P,done} -> ok
  881:     after 3000 -> ct:fail({get_response_timeout,P,node(P)})
  882:     end.
  883: 
  884: 
  885: dump_with_args(DataDir,Rel,DumpName,Args) ->
  886:     RelOpt = rel_opt(Rel),
  887:     Opt = RelOpt ++ [{args,Args}],
  888:     {ok,N1} = test_server:start_node(n1,peer,Opt),
  889:     CD = dump(N1,DataDir,Rel,DumpName),
  890:     test_server:stop_node(n1),
  891:     CD.
  892: 
  893: %% This dump is added to test OTP-10090 - regarding URL encoding of
  894: %% module names in the module detail link.
  895: dump_with_strange_module_name(DataDir,Rel,DumpName) ->
  896:     Opt = rel_opt(Rel),
  897:     {ok,N1} = test_server:start_node(n1,peer,Opt),
  898: 
  899:     Mod = '<mod ule#with?strange%name>',
  900:     File = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
  901:     Forms = [{attribute,1,file,{File,1}},
  902: 	     {attribute,1,module,Mod},
  903: 	     {eof,4}],
  904:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = rpc:call(N1,compile,forms,[Forms,[binary]]),
  905:     {module,Mod} = rpc:call(N1,code,load_binary,[Mod,File,Bin]),
  906:     CD = dump(N1,DataDir,Rel,DumpName),
  907:     test_server:stop_node(n1),
  908:     CD.
  909: 
  910: dump_with_size_limit_reached(DataDir,Rel,DumpName) ->
  911:     Tmp = dump_with_args(DataDir,Rel,DumpName,""),
  912:     {ok,#file_info{size=Max}} = file:read_file_info(Tmp),
  913:     ok = file:delete(Tmp),
  914:     dump_with_size_limit_reached(DataDir,Rel,DumpName,Max).
  915: 
  916: dump_with_size_limit_reached(DataDir,Rel,DumpName,Max) ->
  917:     Bytes = max(15,rand:uniform(Max)),
  918:     CD = dump_with_args(DataDir,Rel,DumpName,
  919:                         "-env ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES " ++
  920:                             integer_to_list(Bytes)),
  921:     {ok,#file_info{size=Size}} = file:read_file_info(CD),
  922:     if Size =< Bytes ->
  923:             %% This means that the dump was actually smaller than the
  924:             %% randomly selected truncation size, so we'll just do it
  925:             %% again with a smaller number
  926:             ok = file:delete(CD),
  927:             dump_with_size_limit_reached(DataDir,Rel,DumpName,Size-3);
  928:        true ->
  929:             CD
  930:     end.
  931: 
  932: dump_with_unicode_atoms(DataDir,Rel,DumpName) ->
  933:     Opt = rel_opt(Rel),
  934:     Pz = "-pz \"" ++ filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)) ++ "\"",
  935:     PzOpt = [{args,Pz}],
  936:     {ok,N1} = test_server:start_node(n1,peer,Opt ++ PzOpt),
  937:     {ok,_Pid} = rpc:call(N1,crashdump_helper_unicode,start,[]),
  938:     CD = dump(N1,DataDir,Rel,DumpName),
  939:     test_server:stop_node(n1),
  940:     CD.
  941: 
  942: dump_with_maps(DataDir,Rel,DumpName) ->
  943:     Opt = rel_opt(Rel),
  944:     Pz = "-pz \"" ++ filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)) ++ "\"",
  945:     PzOpt = [{args,Pz}],
  946:     {ok,N1} = test_server:start_node(n1,peer,Opt ++ PzOpt),
  947:     {ok,_Pid} = rpc:call(N1,crashdump_helper,dump_maps,[]),
  948:     CD = dump(N1,DataDir,Rel,DumpName),
  949:     test_server:stop_node(n1),
  950:     CD.
  951: 
  952: dump_with_persistent_terms(DataDir,Rel,DumpName) ->
  953:     Opt = rel_opt(Rel),
  954:     Pz = "-pz \"" ++ filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)) ++ "\"",
  955:     PzOpt = [{args,Pz}],
  956:     {ok,N1} = test_server:start_node(n1,peer,Opt ++ PzOpt),
  957:     {ok,_Pid} = rpc:call(N1,crashdump_helper,dump_persistent_terms,[]),
  958:     CD = dump(N1,DataDir,Rel,DumpName),
  959:     test_server:stop_node(n1),
  960:     CD.
  961: 
  962: dump_with_global_literals(DataDir,Rel,DumpName) ->
  963:     Opt = rel_opt(Rel),
  964:     Pz = "-pz \"" ++ filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)) ++ "\"",
  965:     PzOpt = [{args,Pz}],
  966:     {ok,N1} = test_server:start_node(n1,peer,Opt ++ PzOpt),
  967:     {ok,_Pid} = rpc:call(N1,crashdump_helper,dump_global_literals,[]),
  968:     CD = dump(N1,DataDir,Rel,DumpName),
  969:     test_server:stop_node(n1),
  970:     CD.
  971: 
  972: dump(Node,DataDir,Rel,DumpName) ->
  973:     Crashdump = filename:join(DataDir, dump_prefix(Rel)++DumpName),
  974:     rpc:call(Node,os,putenv,["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",Crashdump]),
  975:     rpc:call(Node,erlang,halt,[DumpName]),
  976:     ok = check_complete(Crashdump),
  977:     Crashdump.
  978: 
  979: check_complete(File) ->
  980:     check_complete1(File,10).
  981: 
  982: check_complete1(_File,0) ->
  983:     {error,enoent};
  984: check_complete1(File,N) ->
  985:     case file:read_file_info(File) of
  986: 	{error,enoent} ->
  987: 	    timer:sleep(500),
  988: 	    check_complete1(File,N-1);
  989: 	{ok,#file_info{size=Size}} ->
  990: 	    check_complete2(File,Size)
  991:     end.
  992: 
  993: check_complete2(File,Size) ->
  994:     timer:sleep(500),
  995:     case file:read_file_info(File) of
  996: 	{ok,#file_info{size=Size}} ->
  997: 	    ok;
  998: 	{ok,#file_info{size=OtherSize}} ->
  999: 	    check_complete2(File,OtherSize)
 1000:     end.
 1001: 
 1002: dos_dump(DataDir,Rel,Dump) ->
 1003:     DosDumpName = filename:join(DataDir,dump_prefix(Rel)++"dos"),
 1004:     Cmd = "unix2dos " ++ Dump ++ " > " ++ DosDumpName,
 1005:     Port = open_port({spawn,Cmd},[exit_status]),
 1006:     receive
 1007: 	{Port,{exit_status,0}} -> 
 1008: 	    [DosDumpName];
 1009: 	{Port,{exit_status,_Error}} ->
 1010: 	    test_server:comment("Couldn't run \'unix2dos\'"),
 1011: 	    []
 1012:     end.
 1013: 
 1014: rel_opt(current) ->
 1015:     [];
 1016: rel_opt(Rel) ->
 1017:     [{erl,[{release,lists:concat([Rel,"_latest"])}]}].
 1018: 
 1019: dump_prefix(current) ->
 1020:     dump_prefix(erlang:system_info(otp_release));
 1021: dump_prefix(Rel) ->
 1022:     lists:concat(["r",Rel,"_dump."]).
 1023: 
 1024: get_rel_from_dump_name(File) ->
 1025:     Name = filename:basename(File),
 1026:     ["r"++Rel|_] = string:split(Name,"_"),
 1027:     list_to_integer(Rel).
 1028: 
 1029: compat_rel(current) ->
 1030:     "";
 1031: compat_rel(Rel) ->
 1032:     lists:concat(["+R",Rel," "]).
 1033: 
 1034: 
 1035: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1036: 
 1037: %% f(F, A) ->
 1038: %%     lists:flatten(io_lib:format(F, A)).
 1039: 
 1040: formated_timestamp() ->
 1041:     format_timestamp(os:timestamp()).
 1042: 
 1043: format_timestamp({_N1, _N2, N3} = TS) ->
 1044:     {_Date, Time}   = calendar:now_to_local_time(TS),
 1045:     {Hour, Min, Sec} = Time,
 1046:     FormatTS = io_lib:format("~.2.0w:~.2.0w:~.2.0w.~.3.0w",
 1047:                              [Hour, Min, Sec, N3 div 1000]),  
 1048:     lists:flatten(FormatTS).
 1049: 
 1050: %% print(F) ->
 1051: %%     print(F, []).
 1052: 
 1053: print(F, A) ->
 1054:     io:format("~s ~p " ++ F ++ "~n", [formated_timestamp(), self() | A]).
 1055:
